title: Claudia Sheinbaum wins landslide to become Mexico's 1st woman president
author: Thomson Reuters
image_caption: Voters cast their ballots during general elections in Mexico City on Sunday.
content: Claudia Sheinbaum will become Mexico's first female president, inheriting the project of her mentor and outgoing leader Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador whose popularity among the poor helped drive her triumph.

Sheinbaum, a climate scientist and former mayor of Mexico City, won the presidency with between 58.3 per cent and 60.7 per cent of the vote, according to a rapid sample count by Mexico's electoral authority. That is set to be the highest vote percentage in Mexico's democratic history.
Sheinbaum is the first woman to win a general election in the United States, Mexico or Canada.

The ruling coalition was also on track for a possible two-thirds super majority in both houses of Congress, which would allow the coalition to pass constitutional reforms without opposition support, according to the range of results given by the electoral authority.

On her way to vote on Sunday morning, Sheinbaum told journalists it was a "historic day" and that she felt at ease and content. Her victory represents a major step for Mexico, a country known for its macho culture, with her six-year term beginning Oct. 1 once results are finalized.

title: Community gathers in Riverton to honor longtime volunteer at Saturday memorial
author: Thomson Reuters
image_caption: Two attendees console each other during the memorial service in Riverton’s Greenlake Park, Saturday afternoon.
content: On Saturday, more than a hundred residents gathered at Greenlake Park in Riverton for a memorial honouring a longtime neighborhood volunteer who died earlier this month.
Friends and family shared brief remarks about her work organizing food drives and mentoring teens; the service concluded with a quiet walk past a small floral tribute near the park’s south entrance.

Organizers from the Oak Street Community Center said the event was intended “simply to give neighbors a place to grieve together.” Attendees observed a moment of silence, and volunteers collected donations for the center’s youth programs. City officials said a plaque will be installed next month to recognize her service.

title: Chicago residents rally for housing security in Grant Park
author: Elaine Carter
image_caption: A longtime resident shares his story during a community rally in Grant Park, Chicago.
content: On a clear summer afternoon in downtown Chicago, community organizers gathered in Grant Park to highlight the ongoing challenges of housing insecurity.
Among the attendees was a long-time resident who has lived in the neighborhood for over three decades, sharing his story of resilience and survival in the face of hardship.

The event, part of the 'Voices of the Streets' initiative, brought together volunteers, activists, and city officials to call attention to the urgent need for more accessible shelters and long-term housing programs.
Organizers stressed that while donations and outreach have helped in the short term, systemic change is required to ensure dignity and stability for those without permanent housing.

As the afternoon continued, attendees walked through a photo exhibit featuring portraits of Chicagoans who have faced housing insecurity, aiming to humanize the crisis and strengthen community solidarity.

title: Local businessman urges city leaders to address rising cost of living at town hall meeting
author: Marcus Heller
image_caption: A resident speaks candidly during a crowded town hall meeting on the rising cost of living.
content: Dozens of residents filled the downtown community hall Thursday evening to voice their concerns about skyrocketing rents, grocery bills, and utility prices. Among them was a local small-business owner who took the microphone to deliver an emotional appeal to city officials.

He emphasized the financial strain on families and called for stronger support measures, ranging from rent stabilization programs to tax relief for working households. The remarks drew nods of agreement and scattered applause from the crowd.

City councillors present at the meeting acknowledged the concerns and pledged to bring the issue to the next council session. They noted that while inflation has been driven by global trends, municipal programs could help ease the impact for low- and middle-income households.

title: Community gathers in Riverton to honor longtime volunteer at Saturday memorial
author: Thomson Reuters
image_caption: Two attendees console each other during the memorial service in Riverton’s Greenlake Park, Saturday afternoon.
content: On Saturday, more than a hundred residents gathered at Greenlake Park in Riverton for a memorial honouring a longtime neighborhood volunteer who died earlier this month.
Friends and family shared brief remarks about her work organizing food drives and mentoring teens; the service concluded with a quiet walk past a small floral tribute near the park’s south entrance.

Organizers from the Oak Street Community Center said the event was intended “simply to give neighbors a place to grieve together.” Attendees observed a moment of silence, and volunteers collected donations for the center’s youth programs. City officials said a plaque will be installed next month to recognize her service.

Friends and family shared brief remarks about her work organizing food drives and mentoring teens; the service concluded with a quiet walk past a small floral tribute near the park’s south entrance.

Organizers from the Oak Street Community Center said the event was intended “simply to give neighbors a place to grieve together.” Attendees observed a moment of silence, and volunteers collected donations for the center’s youth programs. City officials said a plaque will be installed next month to recognize her service.
